results.title: Great composers
results.brief_description: This renowned BBC series explores the myth behind seven musical composers from the Baroque era to the twentieth century; Bach, Mozart, Beethoven, Wagner, Tchaikovsky, Puccini and Mahler. The programme examines the backgrounds, influences and relationships that make these seven composers part of the fabric of the history of western music. Each composer’s life and work is presented in detail through an amalgam of performance sequences and interviews and comment from contemporary artists and respected authorities.

results.title: Great comedy moments
results.brief_description: A collection of some of the finest comic moments presented on British television from the fifties to the late seventies that were produced at the BBC. Starring a cast of many, there’s Hancock, Marty Feldman, Peter Cook and Dudley Moore, the Two Ronnies, Derek Fowlds, Nigel Hawthorne, Felicity Kendall, Richard Briers, Rowan Atkinson, Eric Sykes, Rik Mayall, Hattie Jacques and Michael Crawford, to name a few…. from programs such as “Blackadder”, “Morecambe and Wise”, “One Foot in the Grave”, “The Good Life”, “Yes Minister”, “Some Mothers Do ‘Ave Em” plus many more…

results.title: Great cargoes
results.brief_description: Gathering crops in countries of the Empire for transportation to the United Kingdom. Then the industries using coal to produce steel, paper, textiles and glass making portholes for the Queen Mary. Electricity is taking over from coal to produce things from fertiliser to aeroplanes. The se are then shipped overseas to the Empire. Shows how ports are needed to accommodate the larger ships, reclaiming the mud flats for this purpose making an half mile quay after six year and ten million pounds.

results.title: Great Barrier Reef (Greek)
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Great Barrier Reef of Queensland is one of the great reservoirs of marine and animal life. This documentary shows in detail, the birds, fish and mammals of the area and the work being done by scientists in studying them. A long sequence deals with the life cycle of the turtle, another with the microscopic creatures of the sea.

results.title: Great Australian disasters of the 20th century
results.creator_credit: Bruce Leonard and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: As unpredictable as ultimate destiny, disasters can strike at any time. They are major misfortunes, occurrences that cause great suffering or privation, and are usually accompanied by the sudden and unexpected loss of human life. Throughout the 20th century, Australian cameramen and documentary filmmakers have recorded on film the great disasters that have befallen this nation, often at the very real risk of personal injury. This video looks at train collisions, aviation crashes, bridge collapses, mine explosions, fires, floods, droughts, earthquakes and cyclones.

results.title: Gravity, weight & weightlessness
results.brief_description: Defines weight as the measure of the pull of gravity. Shows how space scientists are studying gravity, weight and the effects of free fall and weightlessness, in order to launch satellites into orbit.

results.title: Grass displaces scabweed in central Otago
results.brief_description: Land ruined by rabbits and overgrazing is restored (after the defeat of the rabbit pest) by sown tufted grass. Main purpose of the film is to show types of grasses which have replaced scab weed.
